tuv.seg: If you are a victim of crime, you may come into contact with the Gardai, the courts, the Prison Service, the Probation Service, the coroner and the State Prosecution Service
Má bhíonn tú thíos le coir d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeidh teagmháil agat leis na Gardaí, na cúirteanna, an tSeirbhís Phríosúin, an Cróinéir agus Seirbhís Chúisithe an Stáit
Each of those government agencies must provide a service to support and protect you as a victim of crime
Ní mór do chuile cheann de na heagrais rialtais sin seirbhís tacaíochta agus cosanta a chur ar fáil don té atá thíos leis an gcoir
There is also a support service for victims of crime and a number of laws that protect the interests of victims
Tá seirbhís tacaíochta don íobartach ann freisin agus roinnt dlíthe a chosnaíonn leas na n-íobartach
On 16 November 2015 Directive 2012/29/EU establishing minimum standards on the rights, support and protection of victims of crime (known as the Victims’ Directive) came into force
An 16 Samhain 2015, tháinig Treoir 2012/29/AE i bhfeidhm lena mbunaítear íoschaighdeáin ar chearta, tacaíocht agus cosaint íospartaigh na coireachta (ar a dtugtar an Treoir d’Íospartaigh)
The aim of the Directive is to ensure that victims of crime receive appropriate information, support and protection and are able to participate in criminal proceedings
Is é cuspóir na Treorach a chinntiú go dtugtar faisnéis, tacaíocht agus cosaint chuí d’íospartaigh na coireachta agus gur féidir leo páirt a ghlacadh in imeachtaí coiriúla

It provides for information to be given to victims from first contact with the criminal justice agencies and for much additional information to be given in the course of the investigation and court process if the victim opts to receive that information

Foráiltear d’fhaisnéis a thabhairt d’íospartaigh ón gcéad teagmháil a dhéanann siad leis na gníomhaireachtaí ceartais choiriúil agus go leor faisnéis bhreise a thabhairt i gcaitheamh an imscrúdaithe agus an phróisis chúirte má roghnaíonn an t-íospartach an fhaisnéis sin a fháil
It also provides among other things that victims of crime are able to:
Anuas air sin, foráiltear sa treoir, i measc rudaí eile, gur féidir le híospartaigh na coireachta an méid a leanas a dhéanamh:
• Receive an individual assessment to identify their specific protection needs
• Measúnú aonair a fháil chun a riachtanais shonracha chosanta a shainaithint
• Access victim support services
• Rochtain a fháil ar sheirbhísí tacaíochta d’íospartaigh
• Enjoy safeguards in the context of restorative justice services
• Taitneamh a bhaint as cosaintí i gcomhthéacs seirbhísí ceartais aisíríoch
• Enjoy privacy in the context of the criminal proceedings
• Taitneamh a bhaint as príobháideacht i gcomhthéacs na n-imeachtaí coiriúla
A guide to the Victims’ Directive (pdf) is available on the JUSTICIA European Rights Network website
Tá fáil ar threoir maidir leis an Treoir d’Íospartaigh (pdf) ar láithreán gréasáin Líonra Ceart Eorpach JUSTICIA
Further information on the rights of victims is available on the European Commission website
Tá breis faisnéise ar chearta íospartach ar fáil ar láithreán gréasáin an Choimisiúin Eorpaigh
